title: I have a right to play the game however I like
body:
If I am ff'ing and you dont vote yes, I have every right to Attack move AFK farm down a side lane and alt tab. It is YOUR responsibility to carry me. If you insist that the game isnt over till the nexus explodes then I will play however I like. I can't get reported for it :)

If I am to be held hostage in this game, I will do it on my own terms.

replies.body: I mean you can. However people may also have the opinion that you are a "whiny bitch who gives up" (to be clear, I am not calling you that). Upon a manual review, Riot could also decide you are inting/griefing and punish you. Because at that point, you aren't really playing to win, are you?

In other words, as long as he isn't too AFK and doesn't feed, he's fine.

Its like a player who disappears in the jungle for the rest of the game except not trying as hard to be in the game. This could be better since he's pushing a lane.

Edit: Oooh, I'm sorry, are we supposed to be including morality in the rules when interpreting them? No, No. We only care about the rules here. You don't get to say he's morally corrupt for following the rules. Or that he's a whiny bitch. Saying that's what you don't mean? You clearly thought of it yourself. What's wrong with you?

Re edit: the rest of us can though, right? I'll say it. Shame on OP for not trying to win. Really shouldn't do that. Even though it's within the rules to do so. Really scummy though.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lEnLakpA,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2020-02-15T21:21:37.520+0000)
>
> In other words, as long as he isn't too AFK and doesn't feed, he's fine.
> 
> Its like a player who disappears in the jungle for the rest of the game except not trying as hard to be in the game. This could be better since he's pushing a lane.
> 
> Edit: Oooh, I'm sorry, are we supposed to be including morality in the rules when interpreting them? No, No. We only care about the rules here. You don't get to say he's morally corrupt for following the rules. Or that he's a whiny bitch. Saying that's what you don't mean? You clearly thought of it yourself. What's wrong with you?
> 
> Re edit: the rest of us can though, right? I'll say it. Shame on OP for not trying to win. Really shouldn't do that. Even though it's within the rules to do so. Really scummy though.

It's not about "including morality." It's against the rules to disappear into the jungle or attack-move down a lane while alt-tabbed just because you've given up on the game and don't want to respect the results of the surrender vote. Making it "convincing" is just an attempt to avoid getting caught while doing something that you know is against the rules. Encouraging people to break the game's rules is against Boards rules, by the way.
What I actually suggested was that they *don't* AFK. What I did say was OK was not trying to win.

> [{quoted}](name=Nightsky Pirate,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=lEnLakpA,comment-id=0000000000010000,timestamp=2020-02-16T02:28:51.633+0000)
>
> What I actually suggested was that they *don't* AFK. What I did say was OK was not trying to win.

And what you did say was _incorrect_. It's against the rules to stop trying to win.

That really depends on how you want to interpret the rules and what he is doing.

We know, by old admission, that they are going to go from trying to win; to not trying. The method they have chosen is AFK farm by attack move and alt tab.

That, could be consider trolling. On top of the fact that it is also planned, therefore a threat to his team. You know what though, let's take a step back and assume by threat they mean something life threatening. OP still is admitting that they will essentially be Non-participant. This is based off the "attack move, AFK farm, and alt tab out"

When it is all said and done, punishing or not would be up to Riot as in the terms it says:

>The User Rules posted to our websites, apps and games or set out in this section are not meant to be exhaustive, and we reserve the right to modify them, as well as take appropriate disciplinary measures including temporary bans, account suspension or termination and deletion to protect the integrity and spirit of the Riot Services, regardless of whether a specific behavior is listed in the User Rules as inappropriate.

As for the whiny bitch part, yes I figured that would be a common response people may have towards the attitude of someone who has a tantrum due to a failed surrender vote. I do try to look at others perspectives and put myself in others shoes. Which is why I specified that I wasn't. Do I think what op is doing/talking about scummy? Absolutely. Doesn't mean I need to call them names though, I do assume others will though.

That's pretty shady- but fair. Still, they have a responsibility to be non-discriminatory, so if they do it once, they are expected to hold that as a standard or reverse it. That part merely is saying that things can change, (edit) not saying they'll do whatever they want whenever they want.

Alt-tabbing isn't punishable, AFK is (edit again: though he said AFK farm, whether or not he's really AFK is uncertain). If he goes back often enough to keep himself from getting killed over and over, that's really the least that is expected of him under the current defined rules. All about standards and expectations.

(final edit) Sorry about the accusation tone. I've been very salty when seeing specialists or moderators saying more than what I've been punished for, but still... perhaps it's best to not insert what insults you imagine will be given for their behavior.

Yes and no. Blankets can be a risk on their own. An example is INTing Sion. Some people played it more or less "properly" while others just used it as an excuse to int. I also understand it would take a lot of man power to look at it all case by case.

This may be more of an imagination thing, so is left open. When I read what he said, I see basically 0 effort. To me it sounds like he doesn't care if he gets killed while alt tabbed doing his AFK push every x seconds. 

Eh, I get where you're coming from. It could easily be taken as me trying to skirt around the rules. I have had things removed before for such misunderstandings. When I intentionally toe the line, I'm usually straight forward about it, even stating I know I may have action taken against me.

Fair, I can't make promises it won't happen again, but I'll try to be more aware and catch it. üêº
Actually you dont have the right to do whatever you want. You agreed to the Terms of Service which legally binds you to those
Its 'don't intentionally  lose' and 'don't leave the game' not 'always try to win'.

you can call him that pandaa since that's how he react you're not held hostage, you're throwing the game since you lose when nexus go boom anything can happen between time you give up and match end i've seen team go 50-13 and lose since they screwed up 1 single times.
Wrong game buddy, with that mindset single player games suit you better.
Just be sure the semi-AFK is convincing. A in-the-corner YouTube video is a good option. It's not against the rules to not try to win. You just have to not intentionally lose.
I'm playing to have fun. And I dont talk so how can I be a whiny bitch? Maybe I never set out to win in the first place so what exactly am I giving up?
